arts.ttl: FPL notes: Cunha injury latest, Haaland ends drought + Savinho impresses
arts.sum: Our Gameweek 19 Scout Notes begin with Spurs v Wolves and Leicester v Man City The post FPL notes: Cunha injury latest, Haaland ends drought + Savinho impresses appeared first on Best FPL Tips, Advice, Team News, Picks, and Statistics from Fantasy Football Scout.

arts.ttl: Ange Postecoglou future uncertain as Tottenham Hotspur boss draws with Wolverhampton Wanderers in Premier League clash
arts.sum: Ange Postecoglou's Tottenham Hotspur set a concerning record during their 2-2 draw with Wolverhampton Wanderers on Sunday afternoon.

arts.ttl: Spurs stars James Maddison and Brennan Johnson are spotted at Ally Pally for the World Darts Championship - just hours after 2-2 draw with Wolves
arts.sum: James Maddison and Brennan Johnson were spotted at Ally Pally for Gerwyn Price's last-16 clash against Jonny Clayton, just hours after Spurs' 2-2 draw with Wolves on Sunday.

arts.ttl: Yang's rapid rise: From taking Foden's number to signing for Spurs
arts.sum: Asian football expert John Duerden looks at the rise of Spurs' new teenage winger Yang Min-hyeok, who will join on 1 January 2025 from Korean side Gangwon FC. Less so was July’s announcement that Yang had signed a five-and-a-half year deal with Spurs and would join the Premier League club in January 2025.

arts.ttl: FPL GW19 stats: Cunha causes frustration as managers Wildcard
arts.sum: Matheus Cunha (£7.1m) was a popular recruit - indeed he was the second most-bought player of the Gameweek, with 467,000 new owners in total, after amassing 30 points over his three previous appearances. For the third time in four Gameweeks, Alexander Isak (£9.1m) was top of managers' shopping lists, with 677,000+ adding him to their squad.

arts.ttl: On Radu Dragusin's display having been a doubt with an injury sustained at Forest in Boxing Day...
arts.sum: It's just unfortunately we can't give them what they really need and that is some recovery and rest because we've got so many players out, but Radu wanted to play today and you know while he wasn't 100%, we had no choice to put him out there." "He wasn't 100%, but he felt he could get through with his ankle and again, I think the players are all giving everything they can at the moment.

arts.ttl: Strand Larsen's late leveller at Spurs extends Pereira's unbeaten start
arts.sum: It came as no surprise when Hwang swept past Forster as Spurs conceded the opening goal at home for a 15th Premier League match in 2024 – the most by any side in a single calendar year in the competition's history. Jorgen Strand Larsen's late leveller extended Vitor Pereira's unbeaten start at Wolverhampton Wanderers to three matches, while the 2-2 draw at Tottenham Hotspur further increased the pressure on the hosts' head coach Ange Postecoglou .

arts.ttl: Ange Postecoglou admits Tottenham's draw with Wolves 'hurts immensely' as he vows to fight on after stars were BOOED off following late equaliser
arts.sum: Postecoglou will give his players two days off to recharge and reset while he works towards finding reinforcements in the transfer market which opens on Wednesday.

arts.ttl: Ange: Depleted Spurs had to use injured Dragusin
arts.sum: Tottenham's injury crisis meant Ange Postecoglou was forced to field Radu Dragusin against Wolves despite the defender struggling with an injury.

arts.ttl: Ange 'hurting immensely' over poor Tottenham form
arts.sum: Ange Postecoglou admits he is "hurting immensely" over Tottenham's slump in form but still feels they can compete towards the top this season in the Premier League.
